DOC.brief_summary: Prepregnancy obesity , define body mass index ( BMI ) 30kg/mÂ² , show strong association pregnancy birth complication mother child . Most consequently report maternal risk include increase risk gestational diabetes , hypertension pre-eclampsia , increase incidence induction labour , operative delivery , postpartum haemorrhage , anaesthetic risk well risk infection thromboembolic complication . Fetal risk include miscarriage , neural-tube defect , heart defect , macrosomia stillbirth . Initiation continuation breastfeed complicate obese woman normal weight woman . Also later life chronic disease put mother baby 's health risk . The Institute Of Medicine ( IOM ) guideline suggest gestational weight gain ( GWG ) limit 5 - 9 kg ( 11-19,8 lb ) obese woman order minimize synergetic negative health consequence excessive weight gain obese mother child . Preventing excessive weight gain pregnancy postpartum weight retention also important prevention overweight obesity among woman reproductive age . Obese woman general poor diet quality expose psychosocial factor like anxiety feeling depression normal weight woman . The aim project perform randomize control trial ( RCT ) order evaluate effect life-style intervention ( psycho-education midwife 4 prenatal session ) pregnancy birth outcome . Main dependent variable gestational weight gain anxiety depression . Obesity modifiable risk factor optimize adequate gestational weight gain attention psycho-social factor , reduce need adverse perinatal outcome .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Psycho-education Gestational Weight Gain Anxiety/Depression Obese Pregnant Women
DOC.criteria: Less 15 week pregnant Multiple pregnancy Preexisting diabetes Primary need nutritional advice Inadequate knowledge Dutch language
